meanings.definition: The study or practice of predicting the future or future events.
meanings.sent1: In futurisms, experts analyze data to make educated guesses about what may happen next.
meanings.sent2: She was fascinated by futurisms and spent hours reading about different theories on upcoming trends.
meanings.sent3: At the conference, the speaker joked that his futurisms skills were so good, he could predict the next flavor of ice cream.
meanings.sent4: Her futurisms were like a crystal ball, revealing glimpses of what was yet to come.
meanings.sent5: The book on futurisms painted a vivid picture of a world filled with advanced technology and space exploration.

meanings.definition: Beliefs, trends, or movements that focus on the future or futuristic ideas.
meanings.sent1: The futurisms of the group inspired young minds to think beyond the present.
meanings.sent2: Futurisms in art often involve imaginative depictions of what the world might look like in a hundred years.
meanings.sent3: His futurisms about flying cars and robot assistants seemed far-fetched until they became reality.
meanings.sent4: The futurisms of the fashion industry constantly push boundaries and challenge traditional styles.
meanings.sent5: Exploring futurisms can spark creativity and innovation in various fields.
